forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 4pm. Mostly cloudy. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. South southwest wind 1 to 6 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 10pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. North northeast wind around 6 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The dawn unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, framed by the soft embrace of dense clouds that hang low, casting a muted glow over the city. A sense of anticipation stirs in the air, hinting at the rain’s gentle approach this afternoon. The high, only a whisper above 57, feels more like spring held back by winter’s lingering chill. As the day progresses, the temperature will further dip, echoing the weigh of the clouds above, which appear thicker towards the horizon, veiling the Golden Gate Bridge in an ethereal haze. While the morning greets us with a 30% chance of rain before 4 PM, the thought of the cool, damp air invokes the cozy allure of a warm café, where the scent of brewed coffee mingles with the sound of soft chatter.

As evening settles in, an increased 40% chance of rain beckons, tempting wanderers to retreat into cozy corners of favorite bookstores or art galleries, where the mind may wander in delight. Those planning to brave the outdoors should be prepared, donning layers that offer warmth against the crisp wind and a light waterproof jacket to ward off the coming drops. Today is not so much a day for sweeping vistas but one for intimate connections, whether with a captivating read or the muse of local art, where one can linger and ponder away the hours.
